text.__SUMMARY__: Crepis pannonica (pasture hawksbeard) is a European species of flowering plant in the daisy family. It is native to eastern Europe (Austria, Czech Republic, Hungary, Romania, Ukraine, Russia, etc.) and the Caucasus, as well as being sparingly naturalized in the State of Connecticut in the northeastern  United States.Crepis pannonica  is a perennial herb up to 130 cm (52 inches) tall. One plant can produce as many as 8 flower heads, each with as many as 90 yellow ray florets but no disc florets.
